ParentCompanyName: Stakeholder Midstream Crude Oil Pipeline LLC

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ACCIDENT RELEASE PREVENTION AND RESPONSE POLICIES



Stakeholder Midstream Crude Oil Pipeline LLC (Stakeholder) owns and operates a terminal storage facility, the San Andres Truck Terminal in Yoakum, Texas. The terminal storage is designed to receives and stores butane and then inject it into a crude oil line that will be delivered to end markets. 



Stakeholder has a long-standing commitment to workers and public safety. This commitment is demonstrated by our efforts in accident prevention, such as training personnel, quality assurance, and considering safety in the design, installation, operation and maintenance of our process. Our policy is to implement reasonable controls to prevent foreseeable releases of regulated substances. However, if a release does occur, facility trained personnel will evaluate the situation, take actions within the capabilities of the facility, and notify the necessary outside agencies.



DESCRIPTION OF THE STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE



The San Andres Truck Terminal is located Yoakum, Texas and operates a terminal storage facility that storage the following product: 



1. Butane



GENERAL ACCIDENT RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM 



A. WORST CASE SCENARIOS



The worst case scenario associated with a release of flammable substance in Program Level 1 processes at the San Andres Truck Terminal is a vapor cloud explosion involving the inventory of the largest surge tank and related piping containing 85,138 gallons (414,926 lbs). The maximum distance to the 1-psi overpressure endpoint for this worst case scenario is 0.6 mile. No receptors have been identified within the endpoint radius.



B. FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



San Andres Truck Terminal has had no RMP-regulated substance release during the past five year.



C. EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM INFORMATION



The terminal storage maintains a written emergency action plan, which is in place to help protect employees and public safety as well as the environment. The plan iden

tifies steps to be taken in case of an accidental release including: proper first aid and medical treatment for exposures, evacuation plans and accounting for personnel after an evacuation, notification of local emergency response agencies and the public if a release occurs. 



Employees receive training in the procedures to be followed by employees who remain to operate critical plant operations before they evacuate. Stakeholder has around-the-clock communications capability with appropriate emergency response organizations (Fire Department, Police, Sheriff's Office, or similar) This interface provides the means of notifying the public of an incident, if necessary, as well as facilitating quick response to an incident. In addition, Stakeholder conducts periodic emergency drills and annual refresher training for terminal storage personnel.
